poem:
Blank Deals

In the flurry of LED and pixel—  
this gleam of glass, an object sings—  
Silent in luminous promise:  
own tomorrow's vision,  
or at half-off,  
a piece of today's heart.  
The screen a new glow  
for lonely rooms—  
click, swipe—  
absence fills  
with the small hum  
of want made digital,  
priceless.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The 35-plus best US Cyber Monday tech deals on TVs, tablets, phones, smart watches and more Black Friday started off as a way to score some great deals on gifts, but let’s be honest: it’s also a chance to pick up some nice, deeply discounted goodies for yourself. This is especially true in the world of tech, where high prices and personal taste mean it’s often just safest to buy what works for you rather". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: The 35-plus best US Cyber Monday tech deals on TVs, tablets, phones, smart watches and more Black Friday started off as a way to score some great deals on gifts, but let’s be honest: it’s also a chance to pick up some nice, deeply discounted goodies for yourself. This is especially true in the world of tech, where high prices and personal taste mean it’s often just safest to buy what works for you rather
